Updated: 11:07 AM EST Jan 3, 2025 ALERT: A winter storm watch in effect from early Sunday to Monday morning. A winter storm is imminent this weekend for the WLKY region, with a wide range of potentially serious impacts.CLOSURES | INTERACTIVE RADAR| ACTIVE WEATHER ALERTS Sunday morning through Monday, we can anticipate winter storm conditions across a good chunk of the Louisville area and surrounding counties.We'll see a mix of ice, sleet and snow -- with ice currently being the main concern around the Metro.The higher snow and sleet accumulation are expected to be to the north, like in southern Indiana.But in terms of icing, the most significant part and the greatest concern of this whole storm is going to be right along the Ohio River in the I-64 corridor. Some areas could see half an inch of ice or more. The ice has the potential to cause significant power outages and road issues.
